episode_summary: This episode features facts about a teacup amnesty at Bletchley Park during WWII, 18th-century sea captains using sailors as sails, reindeer chewing in their sleep, and a 19th-century MP who thought he was a bird and was succeeded by another who died from a turnip injury.

facts.fact: During World War II, Bletchley Park was forced to have a teacup amnesty.
18th century sea captains sometimes used their sailors as sails.
Reindeer can chew in their sleep.
From 1841 to 1851, the MP for Thirsk thought he was a bird.
